findings.title: lawEnforcementRole can freeze the supplyController
findings.description: The LawEnforcementRole is able to freeze the supplyController balance.

findings.title: lawEnforcementRole can decrease supply
findings.description: The lawEnforcementRole is able to control contractions through freeze functionality.

findings.title: lawEnforcementRole operations are highly visible
findings.description: Knowledge of the new lawEnforcementRoleâ€™s presence could lead a malicious user to preemptively liquidate PAX.

findings.title: supplyController address changes result in orphaned balances
findings.description: The setSupplyController function assigns a new supply controller without transferring the balance of the previous supply controller.

findings.title: Users can send PAX to supplyController
findings.description: There is no check to ensure a user cannot send PAX to the supplyController.

findings.title: Insufficient Logging
findings.description: The contract uses require for halting a transaction in certain instances, such as an authentication failure, but does not emit an event, making it difficult to reconstruct security-relevant logging information during a regulatory audit or to detect when an intrusion has occurred.

findings.title: ERC20 approve race condition
findings.description: Unavoidable race condition in the ERC20 token standard, allows malicious actors to steal funds
